verses.verse: Gilead is Mine, and Manasseh is Mine; (Deut. 33:17) Ephraim also is the helmet for My head; ((Gen. 49:10)) Judah is My lawgiver.
(2 Sam. 8:2) Moab is My washpot; (2 Sam. 8:14; Ps. 108:9) Over Edom I will cast My shoe; (2 Sam. 8:1) Philistia, shout in triumph because of Me.”
Who will bring me to the strong city? Who will lead me to Edom?
Is it not You, O God, (Ps. 108:11) who cast us off? And You, O God, who did (Josh. 7:12) not go out with our armies?
Give us help from trouble, (Ps. 118:8; 146:3) For the help of man is useless.
Through God (Num. 24:18) we will do valiantly, For it is He who shall tread down our enemies.
(Assurance of God’s Eternal Protection) To the Chief Musician. On a stringed instrument. A Psalm of David. [1] Hear my cry, O God; Attend to my prayer.
From the end of the earth I will cry to You, When my heart is overwhelmed; Lead me to the rock that is higher than I.
For You have been a shelter for me, (Prov. 18:10) A strong tower from the enemy.
I will abide in Your tabernacle forever; (Ps. 91:4) I will trust in the shelter of Your wings. Selah
For You, O God, have heard my vows; You have given me the heritage of those who fear Your name.
You will prolong the king’s life, His years as many generations.
